meanings.definition: To return to the original position after being thrown.
meanings.sent1: The ball kept boomeranging back to me when I threw it against the wall.
meanings.sent2: I hope my email boomerangs quickly so I can get a response.
meanings.sent3: The boomeranging boomerang made everyone laugh as it circled back unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her words boomeranged in my mind, echoing their impact long after she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The boomeranging boomerang was like a loyal friend always coming back to me.

meanings.definition: To have the opposite effect of what was intended.
meanings.sent1: His attempt to impress her ended up boomeranging and making her laugh.
meanings.sent2: The prank boomeranged on him, causing more trouble than he expected.
meanings.sent3: The plan to surprise her boomeranged, and she ended up surprising him instead.
meanings.sent4: His lie boomeranged, revealing the truth in a way he never expected.
meanings.sent5: The joke boomeranged, leaving him embarrassed instead of making others laugh.
